TextJPN: 「宝探しってねー！！@k@vS07/02/330200022.　２つ楽しいことがあると思うの。@k@vS07/02/330200023.１つはもちろん、かぁいい宝物を見つけられた時だけど、もう１つはわかるー？！」
TextENG: ``Treasure hunting!!@k@vS07/02/330200022. There's two fun things about it.@k@vS07/02/330200023. One is obviously finding kyute treasures, but do you know the other?!``

TextJPN: 「……汗だくになっても何も見つからなくて、人生と時間の大切さに気付き我に返る時かー？」
TextENG: ``...Getting all sweaty, not finding anything, realizing how precious our lives and time are, snapping out of it, and going home?``

TextJPN: 楽しいことに疲れは覚えないとよく言うが、…レナのあの細い体のどこにこんな馬力が宿ってるってんだ。
TextENG: They say you don't get tired when you're having fun, but... Where in that slender body was Rena storing all this horsepower?

TextJPN: 粗大ゴミの山を漁るのはそれだけでも力仕事だ。
TextENG: Rummaging through an oversized garbage heap was exhausting in and of itself.

TextJPN: 俺は早々に根を上げ、廃車の屋根の上に広げた行楽シートの上で大の字だった。
TextENG: It didn't take long for me to pull out a picnic blanket, spread it on a decommissioned vehicle's roof, and sprawl out on it.

TextJPN: 「ちーがーう～！@k@vS07/02/330200025.　どんなかぁいいものに出会えるかなって、こうして探してる時が一番楽しいんだよ。@k@vS07/02/330200026.だからね、もし何も見つからなくても、それはとっても楽しかったことなんだよ」
TextENG: ``Nooo, that isn't it!@k@vS07/02/330200025. It's the time you spend looking and wondering what kind of kyute things you'll happen to find.@k@vS07/02/330200026. That's what makes it so much fun, even if you don't find anything.``

TextJPN: 「ふむ。@k@vS07/01/330100020.…まぁ、俺もつまらなくはなかったけどな。@k@vS07/01/330100021.お陰で、レナが持ってきてくれた、この水筒の麦茶がおいしいぜ！@k@vS07/01/330100022.　これ、明らかに我が家の麦茶よりうまいよなぁ。@k@vS07/01/330100023.何て言うのかなぁ、香ばしさが違うというか」
TextENG: ``Hmm.@k@vS07/01/330100020. ...Well, it wasn't boring for me, either.@k@vS07/01/330100021. Thanks to all the work, this bottle of barley tea you brought tastes great!@k@vS07/01/330100022. This is definitely better than the stuff at my house.@k@vS07/01/330100023. How should I put it—it's like they smell different, or something.``

TextJPN: 「普通の市販のだよ？@k@vS07/02/330200028.　ヤカンにパックを入れて煮出すだけ」
TextENG: ``That's the normal kind.@k@vS07/02/330200028. You just put a pack in a teapot and boil it to get the flavor.``

TextJPN: 「あー、煮出すってのが秘密だな多分！@k@vS07/01/330100025.　ウチのは冷水に放り込んで冷蔵庫に入れるだけだよ。@k@vS07/01/330100026.やっぱ火が入らないと味ってのは出ないんだなぁ」
TextENG: ``Oh, boiling it must be the secret!@k@vS07/01/330100025. We just dump cold water in and put it in the fridge.@k@vS07/01/330100026. I guess you don't get the flavor if you don't heat it up first.``

TextJPN: 「あ、そうだそうだ、忘れてたー！」
TextENG: ``Oh, that's right, I forgot!``

TextJPN: ぽんと手を打つと、レナは宝探しを一度中断して戻ってきた。
TextENG: Rena pounded her fist, then put her treasure hunting aside for the moment and came over to me.

TextJPN: そして、持ってきたカバンの中から包みを出して広げる。
TextENG: Then, she brought over a bag and took something out before unwrapping it.

TextJPN: …何と気が効く！　クッキーじゃないか！　この不揃い感は間違いなく手作りのもの。
TextENG: ...Why, how considerate! They're cookies! Their lack of uniformity meant they had to be homemade.

TextJPN: 「これ、レナの手作りなのか？！@k@vS07/01/330100028.　いっただきまーす。@k@vS07/01/330100029.うん、うまいうまい！」
TextENG: ``Did you make these yourself!?@k@vS07/01/330100028. I'd be glad to have some.@k@vS07/01/330100029. Mm, yep, these are great!``

TextJPN: 「昨日作った残りなの。@k@vS07/02/330200031.ほとんどお父さんが食べちゃったから、あんまり残ってなかった。@k@vS07/02/330200032.レナもあんまり食べてないのにー」
TextENG: ``They're leftovers from yesterday.@k@vS07/02/330200031. Dad ate most of them, so there weren't many left.@k@vS07/02/330200032. Rena didn't even get to have that many.``

TextJPN: 「そうかそうか、じゃあ俺だけが食べちゃ悪いな。@k@vS07/01/330100031.半分だけ食うぜ。@k@vS07/01/330100032.レナも食えよ！@k@vS07/01/330100033.　会心の出来だぜ！@k@vS07/01/330100034.　うん、むしゃむしゃ！@k@vS07/01/330100035.　この味、舌触り、格別じゃのぉおぉ～！！」
TextENG: ``I see, I see, so I shouldn't eat them all myself.@k@vS07/01/330100031. I'll just eat half.@k@vS07/01/330100032. You have some too!@k@vS07/01/330100033. These are cookies after my own heart!@k@vS07/01/330100034. Mm, munch munch!@k@vS07/01/330100035. This flavor, this texture, oh, they're extraordinary!!``

TextJPN: 「レナはいいから、圭一くんが全部食べちゃっていいよ。@k@vS07/02/330200034.そんなうれしそうな顔で食べてくれたら、作ったレナもクッキーも、すっごくうれしいもの」
TextENG: ``Rena doesn't need any, so you can eat them all, Keiichi-kun.@k@vS07/02/330200034. You look so happy with them, so both Rena and the cookies she made are really happy too.``

TextJPN: 「そうか？@k@vS07/01/330100037.　ならいただくぜ、容赦なくなー！！@k@vS07/01/330100038.　殺せる！@k@vS07/01/330100039.　このクッキー１枚のためになら俺は人が殺せるぜー！！@k@vS07/01/330100040.　むしゃむしゃむしゃ！！」
TextENG: ``Really?@k@vS07/01/330100037. Guess I don't need to hold myself back!!@k@vS07/01/330100038. I could kill!@k@vS07/01/330100039. I could kill a man just to have one of these cookies!!@k@vS07/01/330100040. Munch munch munch!!``

TextJPN: 「あはははは、たとえはひどいけど、うれしいかな、かな！」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha, that's a terrible thing to say, but I'm happy. I am!``

TextJPN: 楽しい団欒のひととき…。
TextENG: This fun moment sitting together...

TextJPN: 素直にレナの宝探しに付き合って正解だった。
TextENG: Going with Rena on a treasure hunt was the right choice.

TextJPN: ……部屋に閉じこもってマンガを読んでるだけで今日を終えちまったら、今日という日に失礼だったもんな！
TextENG: ...If I only ended up shutting myself up in my room with Mion's comics, it would have been rude to the day itself!

TextJPN: 空は少しずつ朱を混じらせていく。
TextENG: Scarlet began to creep into the sky.

TextJPN: 巣へと帰っていくのだろうか。鳥たちの群れが高い空の下を横切っていく…。
TextENG: Flocks of birds started flying past...  Maybe they were going back to their nests.

TextJPN: レナは広げた包みを片付けている。……そろそろ引き上げ時のようだった。
TextENG: Rena had already put away the cookie wrappers. ...It looked like it was time to go.

TextJPN: 「今日の戦果はどうだったよ」
TextENG: ``So what did you dig up today?``

TextJPN: 「うーん、明日以降に期待、かな！」
TextENG: ``Hmm, hopes for tomorrow, I guess!``

TextJPN: 「この山はまだまだ深いよ～ぅ！@k@vS07/02/330200038.　きっと何かが出てくる。@k@vS07/02/330200039.レナには匂いでわかるのー、はぅ～！！」
TextENG: ``This pile goes a lot deeper~!@k@vS07/02/330200038. I'm sure something will turn up.@k@vS07/02/330200039. Rena can tell by the smell, hau~!!``

TextJPN: 「ははははははは。@k@vS07/01/330100043.レナがそう信じてるなら、きっと何か出てくるだろ。@k@vS07/01/330100044.挫けるな！@k@vS07/01/330100045.　金が出るか温泉が出るか！@k@vS07/01/330100046.　楽しみにしてるぜ」
TextENG: ``Hahahahahahaha.@k@vS07/01/330100043. If you say something will turn up, I'm sure it will.@k@vS07/01/330100044. Don't lose heart!@k@vS07/01/330100045. Will it be gold, or a hot spring?!@k@vS07/01/330100046. I can't wait.``

TextJPN: 「明日も宝探ししたら、圭一くんも来てくれる？」
TextENG: ``If I go treasure hunting tomorrow too, will you come with me?``

TextJPN: 「うん？@k@vS07/01/330100048.　俺か？@k@vS07/01/330100049.　そうだなぁ。@k@vS07/01/330100050.またレナの手作りクッキーが食べられるなら、考えてもいいぜー」
TextENG: ``Hm?@k@vS07/01/330100048. Me?@k@vS07/01/330100049. Hmm.@k@vS07/01/330100050. I'll consider it if I can eat more of your homemade cookies.``

TextJPN: 「ク、クッキーの準備がないから明日は無理…。@k@vS07/02/330200042.…クッキー作ってないと、…駄目？」
TextENG: ``I-I didn't bake any more cookies, so I won't have them tomorrow...@k@vS07/02/330200042. ...If I don't make cookies... you won't come?``

TextJPN: 「え？@k@vS07/01/330100052.　あ、あははははは、そんなウルウルな瞳で見んな！@k@vS07/01/330100053.　わわ、わかったよ！@k@vS07/01/330100054.　手伝うからそんな憐れみを誘う瞳で見んなー！@k@vS07/01/330100055.　俺のガラスの良心が痛む～！」
TextENG: ``Huh?@k@vS07/01/330100052. Ah, ahahahaha, don't look at me with those eyes!@k@vS07/01/330100053. O-O-Okay, I get it!@k@vS07/01/330100054. I'll help you, so don't give me that look!@k@vS07/01/330100055. You'll break my glass conscience~!``

TextJPN: 「くす、あははははははははは！@k@vS07/02/330200044.　圭一くんの明日のお手伝い、ゲット～！@k@vS07/02/330200045.　圭一くんと一緒なら、はぅ、何も出てこなくても楽しいよ。@k@vS07/02/330200046.あはははは！」
TextENG: ``Hee hee, ahahahahahaha!@k@vS07/02/330200044. I got Keiichi-kun to help me tomorrow~!@k@vS07/02/330200045. When Keiichi-kun is with me, hau, it's fun even if I don't find anything.@k@vS07/02/330200046. Ahahahaha!``

TextJPN: 普段の宝探しはひとりでするレナだが、たまには仲間がいるのも楽しいんだろう。
TextENG: Rena usually went treasure hunting alone, but she probably also had fun doing it with friends once in a while.

TextJPN: レナは、部活でもなかなか見せないような爽やかな笑いを見せてくれるのだった。
TextENG: She gave me a fresh, invigorating smile, the kind she didn't usually show anyone during club games.

TextJPN: それから後片付けをして帰り支度をし、引き上げることにした。
TextENG: After that, we decided to clean up, pack up, and leave.

TextJPN: そして土手を上がった瞬間、突然、眩いフラッシュが焚かれた！
TextENG: And the moment we went up the embankment, there was a sudden dazzling flash!

TextJPN: 「おわッ、眩しッ？！」
TextENG: ``Ack, my eyes!``

TextJPN: 「はっははは！@k@vS07/08/330800002.　君たちの至福の笑顔、いただきさ！」
TextENG: ``Hah-hahaha!@k@vS07/08/330800002. Caught those blissful smiles on candid camera!``
``T-Tomitake-san.@k@vS07/02/330200048. And Takano-san, too!@k@vS07/02/330200049. Hello~!``

TextJPN: 「くすくす、こんにちは。@k@vS07/09/330900002.ジロウさんもデリカシーのない人よねぇ？@k@vS07/09/330900003.　レナちゃんたちのデートに水を挿すなんて」
TextENG: ``Hee hee. Hello there.@k@vS07/09/330900002. Jirou-san has no tact, does he?@k@vS07/09/330900003. Wrecking your date like that...``

TextJPN: 「デ、デートなんかじゃないっすよ、デデ、デートじゃないデートじゃない！@k@vS07/01/330100058.　そうだよなレナ？！」
TextENG: ``I-It wasn't a date or anything. Not a date, not a date!@k@vS07/01/330100058. Right, Rena?!``

TextJPN: 「は、はぅぅ」
TextENG: ``H-Hauuu.``

TextJPN: 「はっはっはっは！@k@vS07/08/330800004.　こんなひと気のないところに男女が二人で将来を語り合っててもかい？@k@vS07/08/330800005.　いやいやいいんだいいんだ！@k@vS07/08/330800006.　そういう出会いを重ねながら二人の絆を強めていくんだよ。@k@vS07/08/330800007.ねぇ鷹野さん」
TextENG: ``Ha ha ha ha!@k@vS07/08/330800004. A boy and a girl coming to an empty place like this to talk about the future?@k@vS07/08/330800005. Well, well, that's fine!@k@vS07/08/330800006. That's the kind of discussion that will strengthen the bond between you.@k@vS07/08/330800007. Right, Takano-san?``

TextJPN: 「くすくす。@k@vS07/09/330900005.最初の頃のジロウさんの、あれこれ苦しい理由を付けては私を誘おうとするのがとっても面白かったわ」
TextENG: ``Hee hee.@k@vS07/09/330900005. Back when we first met, Jirou-san would always have the funniest, most awkward ways of asking me out.``

TextJPN: 「中でも傑作だった口実がアレね。@k@vS07/09/330900007.えぇと、」
TextENG: ``I remember one masterful excuse in particular.@k@vS07/09/330900007. What was it...``

TextJPN: 「わわわわわ、待った待ったぁ！！@k@vS07/08/330800009.　アレは僕の勘違いで、そのあの！！」
TextENG: ``Whoa, whoa, whoa, hold on there!!@k@vS07/08/330800009. That was my mistake, and, well!!``

TextJPN: 鷹野さんがくすくす笑うように駆け出すと、その後を富竹さんが追い掛ける。
TextENG: Takano-san ran off, giggling, and Tomitake-san chased after her.

TextJPN: こうして遠目に見ている分には、仲良しカップルに間違いなかった。
TextENG: From afar, they looked like they had to be a great couple.

TextJPN: 「あの二人は、一見ちぐはぐに見えて、すっごく仲良しだよね」
TextENG: ``They seemed mismatched at first, but they like each other a lot.``

TextJPN: 「そうだなぁ。@k@vS07/01/330100060.お互いのキャラクターが正反対ゆえに、パズルのピースの凸と凹みたいにバチっと相性があったのかもしれないなぁ」
TextENG: ``Yeah.@k@vS07/01/330100060. They have completely opposite personalities. Maybe they went together like the bumps and dents in puzzle pieces.``

TextJPN: 「はぅ…。@k@vS07/02/330200053.凸と凹がバチっと。@k@vS07/02/330200054.はぅはぅ、どういう意味かな、かな、かなかな」
TextENG: ``Hau...@k@vS07/02/330200053. Just like a bump and a dent.@k@vS07/02/330200054. Hau hau, what do you mean? What do you mean? What do you mean.``

TextJPN: 「ちち、違う違う、そんな変な意味で言ったんじゃないぃいいぃ！@k@vS07/01/330100062.　赤くなるな、そこで赤くなられると非常に気まずいッ！！」
TextENG: ``N-N-N... No, no, I wasn't trying to say anything weird!@k@vS07/01/330100062. Stop blushing! You're only making this more awkward!!``
``I wonder, I wonder!!@k@vS07/02/330200056. Bumps and dents~~ bump dent bump dent~!!@k@vS07/02/330200057. ○△凸※◎~!!!``

TextJPN: ああぁ、駄目だ駄目だレナが壊れちまったぁあぁ！
TextENG: Ahhh, oh no, Rena's completely broken!

TextJPN: こういう時は潔く、俺が一発殴られてＫＯされるいつものオチで収拾する他ない。
TextENG: The only way to solve this is her usual method: punching me out cold.

TextJPN: さぁレナ、覚悟は完了だ！　いつもの電光石火のパンチで俺をＫＯしろおぉお！！
TextENG: All right, Rena, I'm prepared! Give me your usual lightning-fast punch and KO me in an instant!!

TextJPN: と、その時、何かが飛んできて、ガツンとレナの頭に当たった。何事だ？！
TextENG: But then, something flew towards Rena and clunked her in the head. What was that?!

TextJPN: レナが急激にむせ込んで膝を突くと、ゲホゲホと明らかに普通じゃない咳を繰り返した。
TextENG: Rena suddenly choked up and fell to her knees, coughing over and over in a way that clearly wasn't normal.

TextJPN: 「お、おいどうしたよ！！@k@vS07/01/330100064.　大丈夫かレナ！！」
TextENG: ``H-Hey, what's wrong?!@k@vS07/01/330100064. Are you okay, Rena?!``

TextJPN: 咳を繰り返すレナの背中をさする。…一体何なんだ突然！
TextENG: I rubbed Rena's back as she coughed. ...What the heck just happened?!

TextJPN: 「どうしたんだい！@k@vS07/08/330800011.　大丈夫かい、レナちゃん！」
TextENG: ``What's the matter?!@k@vS07/08/330800011. Are you all right, Rena-chan?!``
``Hang on.@k@vS07/09/330900009. Can you breathe?!``

TextJPN: 「今、お二人が何か投げてレナにぶつけませんでした？」
TextENG: ``Did you two throw something and hit Rena just now?``
``Huh?@k@vS07/08/330800013. What are you talking about?``

TextJPN: 確かに見た。何かが飛んできてレナの頭に当たったんだ。
TextENG: I definitely saw it. Something came flying and hit Rena in the head.

TextJPN: 俺はてっきり、富竹さんか鷹野さんが投げた物だと思っていたが、…そんな酷いこと、するわけがない。
TextENG: I was sure it was something Tomitake-san or Takano-san had thrown... but they wouldn't do something so mean, would they?

TextJPN: じゃあ何なんだ。天から何かが降ってきてぶつかったとでも言うのか？
TextENG: Then what was it? Are you telling me that whatever it was fell from the heavens, or something?

TextJPN: 「大丈夫かよレナ…！@k@vS07/01/330100067.　ハンカチ使うか？」
TextENG: ``Are you all right, Rena...?!@k@vS07/01/330100067. Do you need a handkerchief?``

TextJPN: 「唾が気道に入ってむせちゃったのかしら？@k@vS07/09/330900011.　落ち着いた？」
TextENG: ``Did you swallow something the wrong way?@k@vS07/09/330900011. Have you calmed down?``

TextJPN: 「そ、空を見上げながらふざけてたら…、急に何かが口の中に飛び込んできて…、飲み込んじゃって…。@k@vS07/02/330200061.うぅうぅ…」
TextENG: ``I-I was looking at the sky and fooling around... when something suddenly flew into my mouth... and I swallowed it...@k@vS07/02/330200061. uuuu...``

TextJPN: 「飲み込んだぁ？！@k@vS07/01/330100069.　何を飲み込んじまったんだ。@k@vS07/01/330100070.お腹とか痛くないか？！」
TextENG: ``Swallowed it!?@k@vS07/01/330100069. What did you swallow?@k@vS07/01/330100070. Does your stomach hurt or anything?!``

TextJPN: 「痛くはないけど…、違和感があってヘン…」
TextENG: ``It doesn't, but... I feel a little strange...``

TextJPN: 「……何だろう。@k@vS07/08/330800015.昆虫が飛び込んできて、偶然飲み込んじゃったのかな」
TextENG: ``...I wonder why.@k@vS07/08/330800015. Did a bug fly into your mouth?``

TextJPN: 「気になるようだったら吐かせた方がいいわね。@k@vS07/09/330900013.向こうの事務所跡に確か使える蛇口があったはずよ。@k@vS07/09/330900014.水をたくさん飲んで、指で喉の奥を刺激して吐き出すの」
TextENG: ``If it's bothering you, you should try vomiting.@k@vS07/09/330900013. They should have a sink at the office site you can use.@k@vS07/09/330900014. Drink a lot of water, then put your finger in the back of your throat and throw it all up.``

TextJPN: 「そうした方がいいな…！@k@vS07/01/330100072.　レナ、肩を貸すから行こう！」
TextENG: ``That's a good idea...!@k@vS07/01/330100072. Rena, I'll help you stand, so let's go!``

TextJPN: 「どうしたよ」
TextENG: ``What?``

TextJPN: 「……うん。@k@vS07/02/330200066.お腹の中のコロコロした感じがね、すぅっと消えちゃった。@k@vS07/02/330200067.…もう何ともないよ」
TextENG: ``...Yeah.@k@vS07/02/330200066. It felt like something was rolling around in my stomach, but it went away.@k@vS07/02/330200067. ...I don't feel it anymore.``

TextJPN: 「本当に何ともないのかい？@k@vS07/08/330800017.　大丈夫かな…」
TextENG: ``Are you sure it was nothing?@k@vS07/08/330800017. I hope you're all right...``

TextJPN: 「…どうしても気になるんだったら、レントゲン撮って、胃の洗浄をした方がいいかもしれないわね。@k@vS07/09/330900016.本当にもう何ともないの？」
TextENG: ``...If it's really bothering you, we can take an X-ray of your stomach to see if there's a need to remove it.@k@vS07/09/330900016. Are you sure it was nothing?``
``...Yes.@k@vS07/02/330200069. Yep, I'm totally fine now.@k@vS07/02/330200070. Even I don't get it.@k@vS07/02/330200071. ...I'm fit as a fiddle.``

TextJPN: 「そうなのか…？@k@vS07/01/330100075.　念のため、診療所に行って監督に見てもらった方がいいんじゃないのか？」
TextENG: ``Really...?@k@vS07/01/330100075. Should we go to the clinic and have Coach look at you, just in case?``

TextJPN: 「うん、ありがと！@k@vS07/02/330200073.　明日になっても具合が悪かったらそうするね。@k@vS07/02/330200074.でも今日のところはもう全然平気。@k@vS07/02/330200075.みんな、心配してくれてありがとう」
TextENG: ``No, I'm good!@k@vS07/02/330200073. I'll do that if I feel sick tomorrow.@k@vS07/02/330200074. But I'm all better for today.@k@vS07/02/330200075. Thanks for worrying about me, everyone.``

TextJPN: 当のレナが、もう何ともないというのだからそれ以上を詮索してもしょうがない。
TextENG: The person concerned said it was nothing, so there was no point in prying any further.

TextJPN: 富竹さんたちとはそこで別れ、俺はレナを自宅まで送るのだった。
TextENG: We said farewell to Tomitake-san and Takano-san, and then I walked Rena back to her house.

TextJPN: レナの具合が急に悪くならないかと最初は不安だった俺も、今日の宝探しが本当に楽しかったと何度も繰り返すレナの話を聞いている内に、
TextENG: At first, I was worried about Rena suddenly growing worse. But as I listened to her go on and on about how fun today's treasure hunt was,

TextJPN: だんだんその気持ちも薄れ、また明日も一緒に宝探しをしようという話になっていた。
TextENG: my worries drifted away, and we got to talking about going hunting again tomorrow.

TextJPN: 「じゃあね、圭一くん。@k@vS07/02/330200077.お見送りまでしてくれてありがと！@k@vS07/02/330200078.　もし明日の部活が早く終わったら、また一緒に宝探しに行こうね！」
TextENG: ``Bye, Keiichi-kun.@k@vS07/02/330200077. Thanks for taking me home!@k@vS07/02/330200078. If club tomorrow ends early, let's go treasure hunting together again!``

TextJPN: 「おう！@k@vS07/01/330100077.　今日はおいしいクッキーと麦茶をありがとうな！！」
TextENG: ``Yeah!@k@vS07/01/330100077. And thanks for the cookies and barley tea today!!``

TextJPN: 「手作りじゃないけど、@k@vS07/02/330200080.明日も何かお茶請けを持っていくね。@k@vS07/02/330200081.乞うご期待～！」
TextENG: ``It won't be homemade,@k@vS07/02/330200080. but I'll bring some kind of snack tomorrow.@k@vS07/02/330200081. Please look forward to it~!``
``Awesome!!@k@vS07/01/330100079. I can't wait!``

TextJPN: レナははち切れんばかりの上機嫌。
TextENG: Rena's mood seemed so good that she was fit to burst.

TextJPN: そんなレナを見ている内に、俺はさっきの異物騒ぎのことをもうすっかり忘れてしまうのだった…。
TextENG: As I watched her, I completely forgot about the fuss over the foreign object earlier...
